User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0

Maxivista does not support hardware acceleration.  This causes firefox to stop refreshing the screen while entirelly on a maxivista monitor.  (If only partially it continues to work.)  If hardware acceleration is globally turned off, then it works again.  I see in the about:support -- GPU Accelerated Windows 2/2.  I however have 5 screens enabled. (3 are maxivista screens.)  It appears that firefox does not detect these extra screens.  (Win7 display manager does not detect them either.)

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Start Maxivista
2. Move firefox to the maxivista screen
3.

Actual Results:  
No screen updates

Expected Results:  
Hardware acceleration is disabled for the maxivista screens, but not for the good video cards.

comments.raw_text:
Maxivista is sort of a network KVM/desktop extender.  
I am fairly sure that it is a driver issue.  I just didn't see anything pop-up on the search, so I wanted to make it known.  I am not even sure if there is anything that the Firefox team could do about it.  My work around is to disable hardware acceleration globally in FF, but this is not totally ideal.
